passages.text: Reiterate Rating: BUY | PO: 3.10 AUD | Price: 2.70 AUD

2025A EBITDA \(1.9bn\) \(+7\%\) YoY, \(+4\%\) vs.BofA, inline with consensus.FY26 cost guide provided, for choice higher than our estimates. FY26 production guide unchanged except Mozal and Cannington. As previously announced, Mozal going on care and maintenance in March 2026 given insufficient affordable electricity. Cannington ore throughput derated to 1.8 Mtpa (was c.2.2 Mtpa) FY26 to FY31 on challenging underground mining conditions. In FY27, Worsley expected to return towards nameplate capacity. Also see production growth at Sierra Gorda on higher copper grades. Feasibility study on fourth grinding expected in late H1 FY26. Model changes: 2026E EBITDA \(- 10\%\) to \(\) 1.7\(bn. Price objective - 11\%\) to A\\$3.10 (GBp150, ZAR35) c. 1x updated NPV/DCF. Maintain BUY.

South32 previously announced that, as a result of unsuccessful discussions with power suppliers, it will begin the process of decapitalizing Mozal (Link: Death knell for Mozal?). Mozal is expected to be placed on care and maintenance in March 2026. Production is expected to be 240kt in FY26, reflecting fewer pots in operation. Investments in potrelining, typically done on a rolling basis, will cease due to the multi-month payback period associated with them. This situation is really a shame, in our view. Mozal is a fairly well- run smelter and a major industrial asset in Mozambique, contributing c. \(3\%\) of GDP. Mozambique itself is naturally "long" hydro- electricity, over \(90\%\) of local power.

Nickel exit: South32 (S32) previously announced it agreed a sale of its Cerro Matoso Ferronickel operations in Colombia. Completion expected H1 FY26. S32 also sold Illawarra Metallurgical Coal to further streamline the portfolio. Focus on base metals growth projects: Construction advancing at Taylor zinc- lead- silver project at Hermosa. Progress made on sinking the ventilation shaft and main shaft in Q4 FY25. Process plant construction started. Copper options in study and exploration ongoing. Feasibility study at Sierra Gorda for fourth grinding line ongoing. Potential to increase plant throughput by \(c.20\%\) . New environmental approvals secured at Worsley Alumina. Looking to extend LOM at GEMCO beyond 2030. Also progressing options to extend LOM at Cannington.

South32 is a medium sized diversified miner with exposure to aluminium, copper & manganese. Over time as the group executes on its Hermosa project (USA) it will add exposure to zinc, lead and silver. S32 was demerged from BHP in 2015 and has assets located in Australia, South Africa, Colombia & Brazil.

We are constructive aluminium & copper on a medium term view calling them to US\$3250/t and \$12,000/t respectively by 2027. We like the group's pivot away from coal and high CO2 emission commodities to base metals. The Sierra Gorda (copper) acquisition looks well timed expost and we see potential for the Taylor / Hermosa project to deliver value over time.

- EBITDA \(+7\%\) YoY to US\(1.9 bn, underlying earnings \(+76\%\) to US\)666 mn- Worsley Alumina secured environmental approvals for new bauxite mining areas, and Australia Manganese completed its operational recovery plan following the impacts of Tropical Cyclone Megan- Limiting investment in Mozal Aluminium, and currently expect the smelter will be placed on care and maintenance in March 2026.- Continued portfolio transformation with the sale of Illawarra Metallurgical Coal and a binding agreement to divest Cerro Matoso.- Sierra Gorda continued to invest in studies and exploration including a feasibility study for the fourth grinding line expansion, which has the potential to increase plant throughput by \(-20\%\) to \(-58\) Mtpa (100% basis). Study is expected to be completed in late H1 FY26.- Lowered expected mining volumes at Cannington to an average of c.1.8Mtpa over FY26 to FY31.- Extended US\(2.5B capital management program by 12 months to 11 September 2026, with US\)144M remaining to be returned to shareholders.
Underlying EBIT \(+37\%\) on aluminium, alumina and base metal prices, as well as higher copper and aluminium volumes.

Underlying EBIT \(+37\%\) YoY driven by aluminum and base metals prices. Change in basis given sale of Illawara coal assets. Key positive driver of earnings year on year is sales price \(+5968\) mn. Key offsets include inflation (\\$202 mn), negative impact from Australian Manganese (186 mn) and finance and tax costs (188 mn and 360 mn, respectively

Our A\\$3.10/sh price objective is set broadly in line with 1.0x our DCF- derived NPV, calculated using BofA commodity prices and a \(10\%\) WACC and \(0\%\) terminal growth rate.

Downside (upside) risks to our price objective are: Global economic slowdown (growth), volatility in commodity prices, operational risks associated with mining, project execution risk, currency pressures and mining cost inflation (deflation).

FUNDAMENTAL EQUITY OPINION KEY: Opinions include a Volatility Risk Rating, an Investment Rating and an Income Rating. VOLATILITY RISK RATINGS, indicators of potential price fluctuation, are: A - Low, B - Medium and C - High. INVESTMENT RATINGS reflect the analyst's assessment of both a stock's absolute total return potential as well as its attractiveness for investment relative to other stocks within its Coverage Cluster (defined below). Our investment ratings are: 1 - Buy stocks are expected to have a total return of at least \(10\%\) and are the most attractive stocks in the coverage cluster; 2 - Neutral stocks are expected to remain flat or increase in value and are less attractive than Buy rated stocks and 3 - Underperform stocks are the least attractive stocks in a coverage cluster. An investment rating of 6 (No Rating) indicates that a stock is no longer trading on the basis of fundamentals. Analysts assign investment ratings considering, among other things, the 0-12 month total return expectation for a stock and the firm's guidelines for ratings dispersions (shown in the table below). The current price objective for a stock should be referenced to better understand the total return expectation at any given time. The price objective reflects the analyst's view of the potential price appreciation (depreciation).
